item.description:
This event is part of Manchester's 22nd Annual Heritage Day/Pride in Manchester Week!

 

The Lutz Children's Museum is offeringfree admission during Heritage Day and the opportunity to see and climb on big trucks!

A toddler's dream come true!

Parking available at the museum, or free shuttle will be available connecting from the Lutz to the activities in Downtown Manchester, Cheney Hall, Fire Museum and More. Contact Museum for more details. 860-643-0949

 

Lutz Children's Museum, 247 So. Main St.,

Touch a Truck from 12:00 noon to 3:00 p.m. All are invited to see the big trucks, climb inside them and see how they work. and visit the museum free from 12:00 to 5:00 p.m. Visitors can park at the museum to catch the free shuttle to other Heritage Day activities throughout the Historic District. The Lutz museum, housed in a former elementary school, is chock-full of fascinating activities for children. More info at Lutz Museum.

group.name: The Greater Hartford Area Parents Meetup Group

item.name: Touch a Truck & Heritage Day/ Downtown Manchester/Lutz Children's Museum
